FuncDef:
The crc command sets a CRC length for a synchronous serial interface.
The undo crc command restores the default CRC length.
By default, the CRC code length is 32 bits.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the CRC length to 16 bits.
-

Sets the CRC length to 32 bits.
-

Examples: Warning: The encapsulation protocol of the link will be changed.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The CRC length for two interconnected devices must be the same. To set a CRC length, run the crc command.
Prerequisites
The link layer protocol of the interface has been configured as PPP using the link-protocol ppp command.
Precautions
If a device is working in transport mode and the dcn command is run on one of its interfaces, the CRC length of the interface automatically changes to 16.
